block.p: Kimberley Rose Izzo was married yesterday to Bradford Corcoran Emmet. The Rev. Nicholas G. Lang performed the ceremony at St. Paul's Episcopal Church on the Green in Norwalk, Conn.

Mrs. Emmet, 31, is the publicity manager for ''The Late Show With David Letterman'' and ''The Late Late Show With Craig Kilborn'' on CBS. She graduated from New York University. Her mother, Aida Maria Izzo of Nutley, N.J., is a senior accounts clerk at the Valley National Bank in Wayne, N.J.
Kimberley Rose Izzo was married yesterday to Bradford Corcoran Emmet. The Rev. Nicholas G. Lang performed the ceremony at St. Paul's Episcopal Church on the Green in Norwalk, Conn.

Mrs. Emmet, 31, is the publicity manager for ''The Late Show With David Letterman'' and ''The Late Late Show With Craig Kilborn'' on CBS. She graduated from New York University. Her mother, Aida Maria Izzo of Nutley, N.J., is a senior accounts clerk at the Valley National Bank in Wayne, N.J.

Mr. Emmet, also 31, is the manager of technology procurement for the Fort James Corporation, a paper goods maker, in Norwalk. He graduated from Rollins College and received a law degree from Pace University. He is a son of Grenville Temple Emmet III of Leesburg, Va., and the late Patricia Butler Emmet. His father owns WAGE-AM, a Leesburg radio station. The bridegroom is a descendant of Levi Parsons Morton, who was vice president under Benjamin Harrison and the minister to France who accepted the gift of the Statue of Liberty.
